title: Lily-Rose Depp attends The King screening in crop jacket and mini
text:
She's set to star alongside her beau Timothee Chalamet, 23, in Netflix's ambitious adaptation of the Henriad.

And Lily-Rose Depp looked regal as she attended the screening of her film The King in London on Friday.

The actress and model, 20, looked chic in a pearlescent check cropped jacket paired with a black tight-fitting rollneck shirt.

Chic: Lily-Rose Depp looked regal as she attended the screening of her film The King in London on Friday

The beauty, who takes on the role of Catherine of Valois in the film, showcased her toned legs in a black satin mini skirt.

She boosted her height with black ankle boots and accessorised with a leather handbag,

The daughter of actor Johnny Depp wore her caramel locks in a sleek high ponytail while her pretty features were enhanced with a rich palette of make-up.

Timothee takes on the lead role in the film, which adapts Shakespeare's plays King Henry IV and V, and follows its regal star from his life of debauchery as Prince Hal to his transformation into King Henry V.

Work it: The actress and model, 20, looked chic in a pearlescent check cropped jacket paired with a black tight-fitting rollneck shirt

Glow: The daughter of actor Johnny Depp wore her caramel locks in a sleek high ponytail while her pretty features were enhanced with a rich palette of make-up

Earlier this week, Lily revealed that sharing the screen with the Beautiful Boy actor in their new movie was 'nerve-wracking' because he's so talented.

She said': 'It's always exciting to work with somebody who you know has given themselves so wholeheartedly to their role and is so invested.

'It can be nerve-wracking to work with people whose talent you admire so much, but hopefully it can only make things better...

'It can be intimidating. But I think you can take it like that, or like, "How lucky am I to be working with so many people who are so great at what they do, and hopefully I can learn from them." '

Glamorous: After the screening, Lily-Rose was seen departing the Corinthia hotel

Chilled out: The beauty looked relaxed as she headed home after the screening

Lily-Rose also admitted it was also daunting having to 'do justice' to playing a real-life person. She said: 'It was really, really incredible. I loved the research process and just delving into who Catherine is as a person.

'It can be intimidating to play a real-life person, but I think it just adds to the desire I had to do her justice and do as best a job I could.

'Everybody who worked on this project, whether it was in front of or behind the camera, was so impressive, and I was just so excited to be a small part of it.'

Style: Josephine De La Baume looked stylish as she posed up a storm

Lily-Rose was the first cast member to audition for the film, and director Michôd was instantly blown away.

He said: 'I was knocked over by just how poised and still and powerful she was. 'That is not just a testament to her talent, but also to [how] she's been around the circus for a while.'

Michôd is credited as the film's director, and also co-wrote it with Joel Edgerton, who also enjoys an acting career in his own right.

In the film, Joel, 45, plays Sir John Falstaff.

Stunning: Lily-Rose was sure to turn heads in her stylish ensemble as she stepped out

If that weren't enough, Joel also co-produced the film, along with David, Brad Pitt and Liz Watts, among others.

Rumours of a romance between Lily-Rose and Timothee began to swirl at the end of 2018 when fans caught the pair cosying up around New York City, walking with their arms around each other.

The young thespian has previously dodged confirming the romance rumours with Lily-Rose, but he did once tell a reporter at Access Hollywood that she made him speechless.

Last month the pair were seen packing on the PDA with each other on a yacht as they spent time together on holiday in Capri.

Lily-Rose and Timothée are routinely spotted by fan accounts on 'dates' around Paris and New York, but sent the gossip mill into overdrive when they stepped out together at the Venice Film Festival earlier this year.

The King is set to be released in select cinemas on October 11 and on Netflix on November 1.
